summary: Mobile-friendly interactive Valentine-themed webpage to ask "Mr. Bingus" to be the user's Valentine, with playful Yes/No interaction and a meme image shown on acceptance.
architectural_notes: Static HTML/CSS/JS page designed for mobile Safari on iOS (no backend required).

existing_features.title: Create a single, mobile-friendly interactive page whose only purpose is to ask: "Mr. Bingus, will you be my Valentine?" and present exactly two options: "Yes" and "No".

Implement the "No" button behavior so it evades interaction: when the user attempts to click/tap it, the button should move away to a new on-screen position, and multiple 'ü•∫' emojis should pop up around the screen to make clicking "No" effectively impossible.
Implement the "Yes" flow: when the user clicks/taps "Yes", replace the question/options with a success view that displays a cute meme image and the exact text: "aww good choice ü•∞".

Apply a consistent romantic Valentine theme using a pink/white/red color scheme with a coherent, simple visual style suitable for a single-purpose romantic prompt (e.g., a Valentine card look with hearts/paper textures), and ensure all interactions/animations feel playful but not distracting.
Add the required generated image(s) to the frontend as static assets under `frontend/public/assets/generated/` and reference them directly from the UI (do not serve images via the backend).
